      • type

        public Item.ItemType type()
        Description copied from class: Item
        Gets the type of Item subclass. This is used to distinguish between the different Items, especially useful when deciding which table to use when connecting to the database.
        Specified by:
        type in class Item
        Returns:
        type of Item subclass.

      • mechanics

      • uniqueStr

        public java.lang.String uniqueStr()
        Description copied from class: Item
        A String used to check if an Item already exists in the database. For example, for a Customer object, this would include its e-mail. This is because only one Customer can exist per e-mail.
        Specified by:
        uniqueStr in class Item
        Returns:
        a String used to check if an Item already exists in the database.

      • map

        public java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> map()
        Description copied from class: Item
        A Map where all the values are stored. The keys for each value are the same as the column names in the appropriate table for the Item.
        Overrides:
        map in class Item
        Returns:
        the Map where all values are stored.

      • IDStr

        public java.lang.String IDStr()
        Description copied from class: Item
        A String used to identify the Item in its relevant table in the database. For example, for a Customer object, this wold include its CUSTOMER_ID.
        Specified by:
        IDStr in class Item
        Returns:
        the string used to identify the Item.
